noIncrementDecrement.description:
Description

Disallows the usage of the unary operators ++ and —.
Because the unary ++ and — operators are subject to automatic semicolon insertion, differences in whitespace can change semantics of source code.

1let i = 10;2let j = 20;3
4i ++5j6// i = 11, j = 20
code-block.js:4:1lint/nursery/noIncrementDecrement━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ℹUnexpected use of increment/decrement unary operator.2 │let j = 20;3 │>4 │i ++│^^^^5 │j6 │// i = 11, j = 20ℹThe unary ++ and — operators are subject to automatic semicolon insertion, differences in whitespace can change semantics of source code. Instead use += or -=.ℹThis rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future. Visithttps://biomejs.dev/linter/#nurseryfor more information.
